page.title: 08EDUCATION
page.content: In a morning 4 buses come to the village to take the older children (ll to l8) to the big school in Barton. The buses leave the village at half past eight. One stops at the Brocklesby Ox, one stops at the end of Coronaton Road, one stops at Walker's Way and one goes to Ulceby Skitter. Before Baysgarth school was built at Barton the secondary children went to Immingham Secondary Modern School but some went to Barton Grammar School. You had to take the eleven-plus to go there. Now everybody goes to Baysgarth Comprehensive School. Some of the old people of the village only went to our village school and then they went to work when they were l4. The only bit of our old school that is left is the school bell, the rest was knocked down after the new school was built.
